summary: Email from Gail Goodman, a Distinguished Professor of Psychology at UC Davis, to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), providing research articles on long-term memory for child sexual abuse experiences, likely in connection with an expert witness role in the Epstein case.

events.title: Goodman Submits Expert Research to US Attorney's Office
events.description: Gail Goodman emails the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), attaching several of her research articles on long-term memory for child sexual abuse experiences, likely in connection with an expert witness role.

locations: University of California (likely UC Davis, where Gail Goodman is a Distinguished Professor)
keyFacts: Gail Goodman, a Distinguished Professor of Psychology, provided her research on child sexual abuse memory to the US Attorney's Office (SDNY) in November 2021.
The attached research articles focus on long-term memory for child sexual abuse experiences, PTSD, and disclosure, indicating the scientific basis being considered in the case.
The email is marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER', indicating the sensitive nature of the materials and their use in ongoing litigation.
The correspondence suggests the prosecution was engaging expert witnesses to address psychological aspects of victim testimony and memory.
